list.question: 1. Data is segmented at the Transport Layer. Explain why the process of segmenting data is important within the encapsulation process.
list.answer: Dividing application data into segments both ensures that data is transmitted within the limits of the media and that data from different applications can be multiplexed on to the media.
list.answer_simple: Dividing application data into segments both ensures that data is transmitted within the limits of the media and that data from different applications can be multiplexed on to the media.

list.question: Compare TCP with UDP by listing the properties of each. Give an example of data using TCP and data using UDP for their transport protocol.
list.answer: TCP: Connection based Guaranteed reliable and ordered Automatically breaks up your data into packets for you Makes sure it doesn鈥檛 send data too fast for the internet connection to handle (flow control) Easy to use, you just read and write data like its a file UDP: No concept of connection, you have to code this yourself No guarantee of reliability or ordering of packets, they may arrive out of order, be duplicated, or not arrive at all! You have to manually break your data up into packets and send them You have to make sure you don鈥檛 send data too fast for your internet connection to handle If a packet is lost, you need to devise some way to detect this, and resend that data if necessary TCP: Web browsers, email, and file transfer IP Telephony; Streaming Video
list.answer_simple: TCP: connection based, guaranteed reliable and ordered, automoatically breaks up data into packets, support flow control. TCP-Example: email, http UDP-Example: IP Telephony, Streaming Video

list.question: The transport layer uses 鈥榩ort addressing' to identify data flows. How is port addressing used at the server end and the client end? The client places a destination port number in the segment to tell the destination server what service is being requested. A server can offer more than one service simultaneously.
Explain how the 鈥楾hree-Way Handshake' used to establish a TCP connection.
list.answer: Host A sends a TCP SYNchronize packet to Host B Host B receives A's SYN Host B sends a SYNchronize-ACKnowledgement Host A receives B's SYN-ACK Host A sends ACKnowledge Host B receives ACK. TCP socket connection is ESTABLISHED.
list.answer_simple: A sends SYN, B sends SYN-ACK, A send ACK, TCP socket connection is established.

list.question: How does the transport layer manage multiple simultaneous conversations?
list.answer: Connection-oriented conversations Reliable delivery Ordered data reconstruction Flow control
list.answer_simple: How does the transport layer manage multiple simultaneous conversations? Connection-oriented conversations, Reliable delivery, Ordered data reconstruction, Flow control

list.question: TCP offers reliable delivery of segments to a destination. In what way/s is reliability guaranteed?
list.answer: Ordered delivery, Use three-way handshake, window size, Data loss and retansmission
list.answer_simple: TCP offers reliable delivery of segments to a destination. In what way/s is reliability guaranteed? Ordered delivery, Use three-way handshake, window size, Data loss and retansmission.

list.question: TCP has the advantage of managing flow control between a server and a client. Explain how flow control is managed by TCP?
list.answer: When network resources are strained, TCP can reduce the window size to require that received segments be acknowledged more frequently. Although increasing reliability, it also slows down transmission
list.answer_simple: When network resources are strained, TCP can reduce the window size to require that received segments be acknowledged more frequently.

list.question: When using TCP, what occurs when data is lost? How is this different from the way UDP deals with lost segments? As data segments arrive at the destination, acknowledgement is sent back to the host. This ensures reliability. If the host does not receive acknowledgement, data is re-transmitted.
list.answer: As data segments arrive at the destination, acknowledgement is sent back to the host. This ensures reliability. If the host does not receive acknowledgement, data is re-transmitted. There is no concept of acknowledgment, retransmission, or timeout.
list.answer_simple: Using TCP, if the host does not receive acknowledgement, data is re-transmitted.

list.question: At what stage does TCP reorder segments? How does UDP handle out of order segments?
list.answer: Upon reception of the missing segment, the TCP reordering mechanism would be able to assemble the stream. UDP Does not record the order in which data was sent. Often, datagrams will arrive out of order, and the host will simply have to process them as is. It is up to the application to reorder the datagrams if it is necessary to do so.
list.answer_simple: Upon reception of the missing segment, the TCP reordering mechanism would be able to assemble the stream. UDP Does not record the order in which data was sent.

list.question: Explain the following IP Addressing terms:
list.answer: a. Network Address A network address is an identifier for a node or network interface of a telecommunications network. b. Host Address is a computer network that interconnects computers within a limited area c. Broadcast Address A broadcast address is a logical address at which all devices connected to a multiple-access communications network are enabled to receive datagrams.
list.answer_cn: à。网络地址 网络地址是一个标识符用于电信网络的节点或网络接口。 湾主机地址 是互连有限区域内的计算机的计算机网络 ℃。广播地址 广播地址是它连接到一个多址通信网络中的所有设备能够接收数据报的逻辑地址。
list.answer_simple: Network Address is an identifier for a node or network interface of a telecommunications network. Host Address is a computer network that interconnects computers within a limited area Broadcast Address is a logical address at which all devices connected to a multiple-access communications network are enabled to receive datagrams.

list.question: Explain the 'AND' Operation. Why is the ANDing Operation required when using IP Addresses?
list.answer: The AND operation is used to determine whether a particular bit is 1 or 0. AND is used in determining the network address. The IPv4 host address is logically ANDed, bit by bit, with its subnet mask to determine the network address to which the host is associated. When this bitwise ANDing between the address and the subnet mask is performed, the result yields the network address. Logical AND is the comparison of two bits that yields the following results: 1 AND 1 = 1, 0 AND 1 = 0, 0 AND 0 = 0, 1 AND 0 = 0
list.question_cn: 解释“与”操作。为什么需要AND运算操作使用的IP地址时？
list.answer_cn: AND运算来确定一个特定的位是1还是0，并且用在确定所述网络地址。 IPv4的主机地址是逻辑与的点点滴滴，与它的子网掩码来确定该主机相关联的网络地址。当此按位进行AND操作的地址和子网掩码之间进行，结果得到的网络地址。 逻辑与是两比特的产生以下结果的比较： 1与1 =1,0和1 =0，0与0= 0，1和0 =0
list.answer_simple: The AND operation is used to determine whether a particular bit is 1 or 0. 1 AND 1 = 1, 0 AND 1 = 0, 0 AND 0 = 0, 1 AND 0 = 0

list.question: What is the purpose of DHCP? What does it assign to a host PC?
list.answer: With DHCP, computers request IP addresses and networking parameters automatically from a DHCP server, reducing the need for a network administrator or a user to configure these settings manually.
list.question_cn: DHCP的目的是什么？是什么把它分配给一台PC主机？
list.answer_cn: 使用DHCP，电脑自动申请IP地址和网络参数从DHCP服务器，减少了对网络管理员或用户手动配置这些设置。
list.answer_simple: With DHCP, reducing the need for a network administrator or a user to configure these settings manually.

list.question: Define the following terms:
list.answer: a. Unicast unicast transmission is the sending of messages to a single network destination identified by a unique address. b. Broadcast Broadcasting refers to a method of transferring a message to all recipients simultaneously. c. Multicast Multicast (one-to-many or many-to-many distribution[1]) is group communication[2] where information is addressed to a group of destination computers simultaneously. Give an example when each of these would be used.
list.question_cn: 定义下列术语：
list.answer_cn: à。单播 单播传输是信息的发送，以确定一个唯一的地址，一个网络目的地。 湾广播 广播是指同时传送讯息给所有接收者的方法。 ℃。多播 组播（1对多或多对多的许多分布[1]）是组通信[2]其中，信息被同时寻址到一组目的地的计算机。 举一个例子，当所有这些将被使用。
list.answer_simple: Unicast is the sending of messages to a single network destination identified by a unique address. Broadcast refers to a method of transferring a message to all recipients simultaneously. Multicast is group communication where information is addressed to a group of destination computers simultaneously.

list.question: What are private Addresses? Why do we have private addresses and where and when would they be used?
list.answer: private network is a network that uses private IP address space, following the standards set by RFC 1918 for Internet Protocol Version 4 (IPv4), and RFC 4193 for Internet Protocol Version 6 (IPv6). These addresses are commonly used for home, office, and enterprise local area networks (LANs), when globally routable addresses are not mandatory, or are not available for the intended network applications. Under IPv4, the private IP address spaces were originally defined in an effort to delay IPv4 address exhaustion, but they are also a feature of IPv6, the next generation Internet Protocol.
list.question_cn: 什么是私有地址？为什么我们有私有地址，在哪里以及何时使用它们？
list.answer_cn: 专用网络是使用私有IP地址空间，下面由RFC1918 Internet协议版本4（IPv4）和RFC4193的Internet协议版本6（IPv6）设定的标准网络。这些地址通常用于家庭，办公室，企业和本地局域网（LAN）中，当全局可路由地址不是强制性的，或无法提供预定的网络应用程序。下IPv4中，私有IP地址空间中，以努力延缓IPv4的地址枯竭最初所定义，但同时又是IPv6的下一代互联网协议的一个特征。
list.answer_simple: Private network is a network that uses private IP address space. When globally routable addresses are not mandatory, or are not available for the intended network applications.

list.question: IPV6 Addresses will replace IPV4 addresses in the future. Briefly state why this will happen and explain the Dual Stack migration technique.
list.answer: The main advantage of IPv6 over IPv4 is its larger address space. The length of an IPv6 address is 128 bits, compared with 32 bits in IPv4. A dual stack network is a network in which all of the nodes are both IPv4 and IPv6 enabled.
list.question_cn: IPv6地址将在未来取代IPv4地址。简单说明为什么会出现这种情况，并解释了双协议栈移植技术。
list.answer_cn: IPv4的IPv6的主要优点是它的更大的地址空间。 IPv6地址的长度为128位，用32位的IPv4相比。 双协议栈网络是网络中的所有节点都是IPv4和IPv6启用。
list.answer_simple: The main advantage of IPv6 over IPv4 is its larger address space. A dual stack network is a network in which all of the nodes are both IPv4 and IPv6 enabled.

list.question: Explain with sufficient detail to demonstrate your understand, the f0llowing IPv6 Addresses.
list.answer:
a. Global Unicast Global unicast assignment records can be found at the various RIRs or other websites. b. Link-Local Link-local addresses are used to communicate with other devices on the same local link.
c. Unique-Local Unique local addresses are used for local addressing within a site or between a limited number of sites.
list.question_cn: 有足够详细的解释，以证明你的理解中，f0llowing IPv6地址。
list.answer_cn:
à。全球单播 全局单播分配的记录可以在不同的RIR或其他网站上找到。 湾链路本地 链路本地地址用于与在相同的本地链接的其他设备进行通信。
℃。独特的局部 唯一的本地地址用于在一个站点或站点的数量有限的本地地址。
list.answer_simple: Global unicast assignment records can be found at the various RIRs or other websites. Link-local addresses are used to communicate with other devices on the same local link. Unique local addresses are used for local addressing within a site or between a limited number of sites.

list.question: Explain how Stateless Address Autoconfiguration (SLAAC) allows end hosts to obtain an address.
list.answer: Using SLAAC, devices rely on the local router鈥檚 ICMPv6 Router Advertisement (RA) messages to obtain the necessary information.
list.question_cn: 解释自动配置（SLAAC）如何无状态地址允许终端主机获得一个地址。
list.answer_cn: 使用SLAAC，设备依靠本地路由器上鈥檚的ICMPv6路由器通告（RA）消息，以获得必要的信息。
list.answer_simple: Using SLAAC, devices rely on the local router's ICMPv6 RA messages to obtain the necessary information.

list.question: What is the EUI-64 process? Why is this useful method used by LAN hosts?
list.answer: IEEE defined the Extended Unique Identifier (EUI) or modified EUI-64 process. This process uses a client鈥檚 48-bit Ethernet MAC address, and inserts another 16 bits in the middle of the 48-bit MAC address to create a 64-bit Interface ID. The advantage of EUI-64 is the Ethernet MAC address can be used to determine the Interface ID. It also allows network administrators to easily track an IPv6 address to an end-device using the unique MAC address.
list.question_cn: 什么是EUI-64格式的过程？为什么是由局域网内的主机这个有用的方法是什么？
list.answer_cn: IEEE定义的扩展唯一标识符（EUI）或修改的EUI-64的过程。这个过程采用了客户端鈥檚48位以太网MAC地址，并插入在48位MAC地址的中间建立一个64位的接口ID另一个16位。 EUI-64的优点是以太网MAC地址可以被用于确定接口ID。它还使网络管理员可以轻松地跟踪使用唯一的MAC地址的IPv6地址的终端设备。
list.answer_simple: This process uses a client's 48-bit Ethernet MAC address, and inserts another 16 bits in the middle of the 48-bit MAC address to create a 64-bit Interface ID. The advantage is the Ethernet MAC address can be used to determine the Interface ID.

list.question: ICMPv6 use Neighbour Solicitation (NS) and Neighbour Advertisement (NM) messages for the following: a. Address resolution b. Duplicate Address Detection Explain why Address Resolution and Duplicate Address Detection are important in an IPv6 network.
list.answer: Address resolution is used when a device on the LAN knows the IPv6 unicast address of a destination but does not know its Ethernet MAC address. When a device is assigned a global unicast or link-local unicast address, it is recommended DAD is performed on the address to ensure that it is unique.
list.question_cn: ICMPv6的使用邻居请求（NS）和邻居通告（NM）消息如下： à。地址解析 湾重复地址检测 解释为什么地址解析和重复地址检测是在IPv6网络中非常重要的。
list.answer_cn: 地址解析时使用局域网上的设备知道目的地的IPv6单播地址，但不知道它的以太网MAC地址。 当一个设备分配一个全局单播或链路本地单播地址，推荐DAD上的地址进行，以确保它是独一无二的。

list.question: Network Administrators are required to manage a great number of tasks. One such task is to manage growing networks. Keeping this in mind, what is the purpose of capturing traffic with a protocol analyser (such as Wireshark) and how might this be used to improve service delivery?
list.question_cn: 网络管理员需要管理的任务有很大的数目。一个这样的任务是管理不断增长的网络。牢记这一点，什么是捕获流量使用协议分析器（如Wireshark的），以及如何的目的，这可能被用来改善服务交付？
list.answer_cn: What is the purpose of capturing traffic and how might this be used to improve service delivery?
list.answer_simple: To determine traffic flow patterns. Capture traffic during peak utilization times to get a good representation of the different traffic types.
list.answer_draft: To determine traffic flow patterns, it is important to: Capture traffic during peak utilization times to get a good representation of the different traffic types. Perform the capture on different network segments, because some traffic will be local to a particular segment. Information gathered by the protocol analyzer is analyzed based on the source and destination of the traffic as well as the type of traffic being sent. This analysis can be used to make decisions on how to manage the traffic more efficiently. This can be done by reducing unnecessary traffic flows or changing flow patterns altogether by moving a server, for example. Sometimes, simply relocating a server or service to another network segment improves network performance and accommodates the growing traffic needs. At other times, optimizing the network performance requires major network redesign and intervention.

list.question: Three network security factors are vulnerability, threat and attack. Taking vulnerability, explain one technical vulnerability, one configuration vulnerability and one policy vulnerability.
list.question_cn: 三大网络安全因素的脆弱性，威胁和攻击。以脆弱性， 解释一个技术漏洞，配置漏洞和一个策略 漏洞。
list.answer_cn: vulnerability
list.answer_simple: Operating system weakness, Unsecured user accounts, Lack of written security policy Operating system weakness Each operating system has security problems that must be addressed. Unsecured user accounts User account information may be transmitted insecurely across the network. Lack of written security policy An unwritten policy cannot be consistently applied or enforced.

list.question: One kind of network attack is "reconnaissance attacks". Briefly explain the following Reconnaissance Attacks: a. Internet Queries b. Ping sweeps c. Port Scans d. Packet Sniffers
list.question_cn: 一种网络攻击是“侦察攻击”。简要解释如下 侦察攻击： à。上网查询 湾ping扫描 ℃。端口扫描 ??。数据包嗅探器
list.answer_cn: reconnaissance attacks
list.answer_simple: Internet Queries: to determine the ip addresses by using internet tools. Ping sweeps is a method that can establish a range of IP addresses. Port Scans : an attack that sends client requests to a range of server port addresses on a host Packet Sniffers: a computer program or a piece of computer hardware.
list.answer_draft: a. Internet Queries: to determine the ip addresses by using intenet tools such as nslookup and whois utilities. b. Ping sweeps : is a method that can establish a range of IP addresses which map to live hosts. c. Port Scans : an attack that sends client requests to a range of server port addresses on a host, with the goal of finding an active port and exploiting a known vulnerability of that service,[1] although the majority of uses of a port scan are not attacks and are simple probes to determine services available on a remote machine. d. Packet Sniffers: a computer program or a piece of computer hardware that can intercept and log traffic passing over a digital network or part of a network.

list.question: Attacks can be mitigated using AAA. Briefly explain each of the A's in AAA.
list.answer: Authentication - Users and administrators must prove their identity Authentication can be established using their identity. Authorization - which resources the user can access and which operations the user is allowed to perform. Accounting - records what the user accessed, the amount of time the resource is accessed, and any changes made.
list.question_cn: 攻击可以采用AAA缓解。先简单介绍一下每个A在AAA级。
list.answer_cn: AAA
list.answer_simple: Authentication, Authorization, Accounting

list.question: Explain the difference between a weak and strong password. Why should strong passwords be used? How often should passwords be changed?
list.question_cn: 解释弱和强密码的区别。为什么要使用强密码 可以用吗？应该多久的密码进行更改？
list.answer_cn: Password
list.answer_simple: Weak password: simple characters or numbers. Strong password: a mix of upper lower case, number, symbols. Every three months.
list.answer_draft: Weak paasword is comprised of simple words characters numbers and is easy to be cracked. Strong password is a mix of upper lower case, number m symybols and spaces, is hard to be cracked. To increses the account and decice security Every three months

list.question: For what purpose/s does a network administrator use ping?
list.answer: Test network connectivity
list.question_cn: 目的是什么/ S做了网络管理员使用ping？
list.answer_cn: Ping
list.answer_simple: Test network connectivity
list.answer_draft: Using the ping command is an effective way to test connectivity. The ping command will not always pinpoint the nature of a problem, but it can help to identify the source of the problem, an important first step in troubleshooting a network failure. The ping command provides a method for checking the protocol stack and IPv4 address configuration on a host as well as testing connectivity to local or remote destination hosts,

list.question: What important information is obtained from the 'show version' command? How might this information be used?
list.answer: Cisco IOS version Cisco IOS version System bootstrap Cisco IOS image Cisco IOS image CPU and RAM N b dt f Number and type of physical interfaces Amount of NVRAM Config register
list.question_cn: 从“显示版本”命令，得到什么重要的信息？怎么可能这些信息可以用吗？
list.answer_cn: show version
list.answer_simple: Software version, Bootstrap version, System up-time, System restart info
list.answer_draft: Software version - IOS software version Bootstrap version - Bootstrap version System up-time - Time since last reboot System restart info - Method of restart (e.g., power cycle, crash) Software image name - IOS filename Switch platform and processor type - Model number and processor type Memory type (shared/main) - Main processor RAM and shared packet I/O buffering Hardware interfaces - Interfaces available on the switch Configuration register - Sets bootup specifications, console speed setting, and related parameters.

list.question: Router and Switch configuration files should always be backed up. List as many methods as you can to do this, and briefly describe each method.
list.question_cn: 路由器和交换机的配置文件应该总是????备份。列出尽可能多的方法，你可以做到这一点，并简要介绍每一种方法。
list.answer_cn: Backup Configurations
list.answer_simple: with Text capture, TFTP, USB flash drive or USB port on switch
list.answer_draft:
1) Backup Configurations with Text Capture (Tera Term) Configuration files can be saved/archived to a text file using Tera Term. As shown in the figure, the steps are: Step 1. On the File menu, click Log. Step 2. Choose the location to save the file. Tera Term will begin capturing text. Step 3. After capture has been started, execute the show running-config or show startup-config command at the privileged EXEC prompt. Text displayed in the terminal window will be directed into the chosen file. Step 4. When the capture is complete, select Close in the Tera Term: Log window. Step 5. View the file to verify that it was not corrupted.
2) Backup Configurations with TFTP Copies of configuration files should be stored as backup files in the event of a problem. Configuration files can be stored on a Trivial File Transfer Protocol (TFTP) server or a USB drive. A configuration file should also be included in the network documentation. To save the running configuration or the startup configuration to a TFTP server, use either the copy running-config tftp or copy startup-config tftp command as shown in the figure. Follow these steps to back up the running configuration to a TFTP server: Step 1. Enter the copy running-config tftpcommand. Step 2. Enter the IP address of the host where the configuration file will be stored. Step 3. Enter the name to assign to the configuration file. Step 4. Press Enter to confirm each choice.
3) using usb port on swithch The Universal Serial Bus (USB) storage feature enables certain models of Cisco routers to support USB flash drives. The USB flash feature provides an optional secondary storage capability and an additional boot device. Images, configurations, and other files can be copied to or from the Cisco USB flash memory with the same reliability as storing and retrieving files using the Compact Flash card. In addition, modular integrated services routers can boot any Cisco IOS Software image saved on USB flash memory. 4) Backup Configurations with a USB flash drive When backing up to a USB port, it is a good idea to issue theshow file systems command to verify that the USB drive is there and confirm the name, as shown in Figure 1. Next, use the copy run usbflash0:/ command to copy the configuration file to the USB flash drive. Be sure to use the name of the flash drive, as indicated in the file system. The slash is optional but indicates the root directory of the USB flash drive. The IOS will prompt for the filename. If the file already exists on the USB flash drive, the router will prompt for overwrite, as seen in Figure 2. Use the dir command to see the file on the USB drive and use the more command to see the contents, as seen in Figure 3.

list.question: Considering a wireless router, what is the difference between WEP and WPA?
list.answer: Wired Equivalency Protocol (WEP) - uses pre-configured keys to encrypt and decrypt data. Every wireless device allowed to access the network must have the same WEP key entered. Wi-Fi Protected Access (WPA) – also uses encryption keys from 64 bits up to 256 bits. New keys are generated each time a connection is established with the AP. Therefore more secure
list.question_cn: 考虑到无线路由器，什么是WEP和WPA的区别？
list.answer_cn: WEP & WPA
list.answer_simple: WEP: uses pre-configured keys to encrypt and decrypt data. WPA: uses encryption keys from 64 bits up to 256 bits. more secure

list.question: What is the purpose of the physical layer media in a networked environment?
list.answer: The OSI physical layer provides the means to transport the bits that make up a data link layer frame across the network media. This layer accepts a complete frame from the data link layer and encodes it as a series of signals that are transmitted onto the local media. The encoded bits that comprise a frame are received by either an end device or an intermediate device.
list.question_cn: 物理层媒体在网络环境的目的是什么？
list.answer_cn: 在OSI物理层提供的装置运送构成整个网络媒体的数据链路层帧中的位。该层接受来自数据链路层的完整的帧，它作为一个系列的信号被发送到本地媒体编码。编码比特组成一个帧是由任一终端设备或中间设备接收到的。
list.answer_simple: The OSI physical layer provides the means to transport the bits that make up a data link layer frame across the network media.

list.question: Data is sent as signals on media. These signals can be either ‘Asynchronous’ or ‘Synchronous’. Explain both these methods.
list.answer: Asynchronous: Data signals are transmitted without an associated clock signal. The time spacing between data characters or blocks may be of arbitrary duration, meaning the spacing is not standardized. Therefore, frames require start and stop indicator flags.( Data signals are transmitted without an associated clock signal. The time spacing between data characters or blocks may be of arbitrary duration, meaning the spacing is not standardized. Therefore, frames require start and stop indicator flags.) Synchronous: Data signals are sent along with a clock signal which occurs at evenly spaced time durations referred to as the bit time.
list.question_cn: 数据发送的媒体信号。这些信号可以是“异步”或“同步”。说明这两种方法。
list.answer_cn: 异步：数据信号没有关联的时钟信号传输。数据的字符或块之间的时间间隔可以是任意的持续时间，这意味着间距不规范。因此，框架需要启动和停止指示标志。（数据信号没有关联的时钟信号传输的实时数据字符或块之间的间隔可以是任意的持续时间，这意味着间距不规范，因此，框架需要启动和停止指示灯标记。） 同步：数据信号连同其发生在被称为位时间均匀间隔的持续时间的时钟信号发送。
list.answer_simple: Asynchronous: Data signals are transmitted without an associated clock signal. Synchronous: Data signals are sent along with a clock signal which occurs at evenly spaced time durations referred to as the bit time.

list.question: Copper Cabling is subject to interference from Electromagnetic interference (EMI) or radio frequency interference (RFI) and Crosstalk. Explain how these interferences affect data signals. What is the source of these interferences?
list.answer: Electromagnetic interference (EMI) or radio frequency interference (RFI) - EMI and RFI signals can distort and corrupt the data signals being carried by copper media. Potential sources of EMI and RFI include radio waves and electromagnetic devices such as fluorescent lights or electric motors. Crosstalk - Crosstalk is a disturbance caused by the electric or magnetic fields of a signal on one wire to the signal in an adjacent wire. In telephone circuits, crosstalk can result in hearing part of another voice conversation from an adjacent circuit. Specifically, when electrical current flows through a wire, it creates a small, circular magnetic field around the wire which can be picked up by an adjacent wire. The sources of these interferences are the timing and voltage values of the electrical pulses.
list.question_cn: 铜布线是受到来自电磁干扰（EMI）或无线电频率干扰（RFI）和串音干扰。解释这些干扰如何影响数据信号。什么是这些干扰的来源？
list.answer_cn: 电磁干扰（EMI）和射频干扰（RFI） - EMI和RFI信号可以歪曲和破坏数据信号由铜介质进行。 EMI和RFI的潜在来源包括无线电波和电磁设备，如荧光灯或电动马达。 相声 - 串扰是相邻线引起的信号的电场或磁场在一根导线上的信号干扰。在电话电路，串扰会导致从相邻电路听到了另一种声音对话的一部分。特别是，当电流流过导线，它创建了一个小的，圆形的磁性各地可拾起相邻的线丝领域。 这些干扰的来源是在电脉冲的定时和电压值。
list.answer_simple: EMI and RFI signals can distort and corrupt the data signals being carried by copper media. Crosstalk is a disturbance caused by the electric or magnetic fields of a signal on one wire to the signal in an adjacent wire.

list.question: UTP Cabling is the most common form of network cabling today. Keeping this in mind, what must be considered when installing cabling for a network? (Be sure to include information about the following elements – cable types, lengths, connectors, terminators and methods of testing.)

list.question: Explain the difference between single-mode fibre (SMF) and Multimode Fibre (MMF) cables. When might each be used?
list.answer: Single-mode fiber (SMF): Consists of a very small core and uses expensive laser technology to send a single ray of light. Popular in long-distance situations spanning hundreds of kilometers such as required in long haul telephony and cable TV applications. Multimode fiber (MMF): Consists of a larger core and uses LED emitters to send light pulses. Specifically, light from an LED enters the multimode fiber at different angles. Popular in LANs because they can be powered by low cost LEDs. It provides bandwidth up to 10 Gb/s over link lengths of up to 550 meters.
list.question_cn: 解释的单模光纤（SMF）和多模光纤（MMF）电缆之间的差异。 当每一个可能被使用？
list.answer_cn: 单模光纤（SMF）：由一个非常小的内核，并采用昂贵的激光技术，光传送一个单一的光线。流行在长距离的情况下横跨数百公里如在长途电话和有线电视应用所需。 多模光纤（MMF）：由一个较大的核心，并使用LED发射器发出的光脉冲。具体地，光从LED进入多模光纤以不同的角度。流行的局域网，因为它们可以通过低成本的LED供电。它提供的带宽高达10 Gb/ s以上的高达550米的链路长度。
list.answer_simple: Single-mode fiber (SMF): Consists of a very small core and uses expensive laser technology to send a single ray of light. Multimode fiber (MMF): Consists of a larger core and uses LED emitters to send light pulses.

list.question: In wireless networks most devices use either 802.11n, 802.11ac or 802.11ad. Compare and explain the properties of each. Which method would be used at a. UTS b. Within your home
list.answer:
a. UTS IEEE 802.11n: Operates in the 2.4 GHz and 5 GHz frequency bands. The typical expected data rates range from 150 Mb/s to 600 Mb/s with a distance range of up to 70 meters. It is backward compatible with 802.11a/b/g devices.
b. Within your home IEEE 802.11g: Operates in the 2.4 GHz frequency band and offers speeds of up to 54 Mbps. Devices implementing this standard therefore operate at the same radio frequency and range as 802.11b but with the bandwidth of 802.11a.
list.question_cn: 在无线网络中大多数设备可以使用的802.11n，802.11ac标准或802.11ad标准。比较和 解释每个的属性。该方法将用于在。 UTS 湾在你的家
list.answer_cn:
IEEE802.11n标准：工作在2.4 GHz和5 GHz频段。典型的预期数据速率范围从150 Mb / s到600 Mb / s的可达70米的距离范围内。它是向下兼容的802.11a / b/ g设备兼容。
湾在你的家 IEEE 802.11g的：运行在2.4 GHz频段，提供速度高达54 Mbps。设备实施本标准，因此在相同的无线电频率和范围为802.11，但与802.11的带宽操作。
list.answer_simple: UTS: IEEE 802.11n: Operates in the 2.4 GHz and 5 GHz frequency bands. Home: IEEE 802.11g: Operates in the 2.4 GHz frequency band and offers speeds of up to 54 Mbps.

list.question: The Data Link Layer is divided into two sub-layers, the LLC and MAC sub-layers. Why is this division used? Explain the purpose of each sub-layer.
list.answer: The purpose of division: Separating the data link layer into sublayers allows for one type of frame defined by the upper layer to access different types of media defined by the lower layer. Such is the case in many LAN technologies, including Ethernet. ?? Logical Link Control (LLC): This upper sublayer defines the software processes that provide services to the network layer protocols. It places information in the frame that identifies which network layer protocol is being used for the frame. This information allows multiple Layer 3 protocols, such as IPv4 and IPv6, to utilize the same network interface and media. ?? Media Access Control (MAC): This lower sublayer defines the media access processes performed by the hardware. It provides data link layer addressing and delimiting of data according to the physical signaling requirements of the medium and the type of data link layer protocol in use.
list.question_cn: 在数据链路层被分为两个子层中，LLC和MAC子层。为什么用这样的划分？说明各子层的目的。
list.answer_cn: 师的目的：分离数据链路层分成子层允许由上层定义来访问不同类型的由下层确定的培养基一种类型的帧。例如，在许多LAN技术，包括以太网的情况。 ??逻辑链路控制（LLC）：该上部子层定义了网络层协议提供服务的软件的过程。它放置在标识该网络层协议被用于该帧的帧信息。该信息允许多个第3层协议，例如IPv4和IPv6中，利用相同的网络接口和媒体。 ??媒体访问控制（MAC）：此下部子层定义了硬件所执行的媒体接入流程。它提供了数据链路层数据的寻址和根据该介质的物理信令要求和数据链路层协议的使用的类型划分。
list.answer_draft: Logical Link Control (LLC): This upper sublayer defines the software processes that provide services to the network layer protocols. Media Access Control (MAC): This lower sublayer defines the media access processes performed by the hardware.

list.question: Look carefully at the figure showing the Ethernet Frame. Explain each of the fields shown.
list.answer: Frame start and stop indicator flags: Used by the MAC sublayer to identify the beginning and end limits of the frame. Addressing: Used by the MAC sublayer to identify the source and destination nodes. Type: Used by the LLC to identify the Layer 3 protocol. Control: Identifies special flow control services. Data: Contains the frame payload (i.e., packet header, segment header, and the data). Error Detection: Included after the data to form the trailer, these frame fields are used for error detection.
list.question_cn: 仔细看看图中显示的以太网帧。解释每个中所示的字段。
list.answer_cn: 帧开始和结束指示符标志：用于由MAC子层识别帧的开始和结束范围。 处理：使用由MAC子层识别的源节点和目的节点。 类型：使用的有限责任公司，以确定的第3层协议。 控制：识别特殊的流量控制服务。 数据：包含在帧有效载荷（即，数据包报头，分段报头和数据）。 错误检测：数据后，包括形成预告片，这些帧字段用于错误检测。
list.answer_simple: Frame start and stop indicator flags: Used by the MAC sublayer to identify the beginning and end limits of the frame. Addressing: Used by the MAC sublayer to identify the source and destination nodes. Type: Used by the LLC to identify the Layer 3 protocol. Control: Identifies special flow control services. Data: Contains the frame payload (i.e., packet header, segment header, and the data). Error Detection: Included after the data to form the trailer, these frame fields are used for error detection.

list.question: Explain the difference between a Physical Topology and a Logical Topology.
list.answer: Physical topology: Refers to the physical connections and identifies how end devices and infrastructure devices such as routers, switches, and wireless access points are interconnected. Physical topologies are usually point-to-point or star. Logical topology: Refers to the way a network transfers frames from one node to the next. This arrangement consists of virtual connections between the nodes of a network. These logical signal paths are defined by data link layer protocols. The logical topology of point-to-point links is relatively simple while shared media offers deterministic and a non-deterministic media access control methods.
list.question_cn: 解释物理拓扑和逻辑拓扑之间的差异。
list.answer_cn: 物理拓扑结构：是指在物理连接，并识别终端设备和基础设施设备，如路由器，交换机，以及无线接入点如何被互连。物理拓扑结构通常是指对点或星形。 逻辑拓扑结构：是指一个网络需要从一个节点到下一个帧的方式。这种结构由一个网络的节点之间的虚拟连接。通过数据定义这些逻辑信号路径的链路层协议。的点至点链接的逻辑拓扑结构相对简单，而共享媒体提供的确定性和非确定性的介质访问控制方法。
list.answer_simple: Physical topology: Refers to the physical connections and identifies how end devices and infrastructure devices are interconnected. Logical topology: Refers to the way a network transfers frames from one node to the next.

list.question: Explain the following physical topologies: a. Star b. Extended star c. Bus d. Ring
list.answer:
a. Star End devices are connected to a central intermediate device. Early star topologies interconnected end devices using hubs. However, star topologies now use switches. The star topology is the most common physical LAN topology primarily because it is easy to install, very scalable (easy to add and remove end devices), and easy to troubleshoot.
b. Extended star In an extended star topology, central intermediate devices interconnect other star topologies. In a hybrid topology, the star networks may interconnect using a bus topology. c. Bus All end systems are chained to each other and terminated in some form on each end. Infrastructure devices such as switches are not required to interconnect the end devices. Bus topologies were used in legacy Ethernet networks because it was inexpensive to use and easy to set up. d. Ring End systems are connected to their respective neighbor forming a ring. Unlike the bus topology, the ring does not need to be terminated. Ring topologies were used in legacy Fiber Distributed Data Interface (FDDI) networks. Specifically, FDDI networks employ a second ring for fault tolerance or performance enhancements.
list.question_cn: 解释下列物理拓扑结构： à。星 湾扩展球星C。巴士 e。环
list.answer_cn:
à。星 端设备连接到中央的中间设备。早期的星型拓扑结构相互连接使用集线器终端设备。然而，星型拓扑结构现在使用的交换机。星型拓扑结构是最常见的物理LAN拓扑结构，主要是因为它易于安装，非常可伸缩的（便于添加和删除终端设备），并且容易解决。
湾扩展明星 在扩展星型拓扑结构，核心中间设备互连等星型拓扑结构。在混合拓扑，星型网络，可以利用互连总线拓扑。 ℃。巴士 所有端系统被链接到彼此并终止在某种形式的每一端。基础设施设备如交换机无需相互连接的终端设备。总线拓扑结构是在传统的以太网网络中使用，因为它是便宜的使用，并且容易设置。 ??。环 端系统连接到它们各自的邻居形成环。不像总线拓扑，环型并不需要被终止。环形拓扑结构是在传统的光纤分布式数据接口（FDDI）网络中使用。具体来说，FDDI网络采用了容错功能和性能增强的第二环。
list.answer_simple: Star: End devices are connected to a central intermediate device. Extended star: In an extended star topology, central intermediate devices interconnect other star topologies. Bus: All end systems are chained to each other and terminated in some form on each end. Ring: End systems are connected to their respective neighbor forming a ring.

list.answer: a. Unicast unicast transmission is the sending of messages to a single network destination identified by a unique address. b. Broadcast Broadcasting refers to a method of transferring a message to all recipients simultaneously. c. Multicast Multicast (one-to-many or many-to-many distribution[1]) is group communication[2] where information is addressed to a group of destination computers simultaneously.
list.question_cn: When is each used?
list.answer_simple: Unicast transmission is the sending of messages to a single network destination identified by a unique address. list.question: EUI-64 is a particular addressing process using IPv6. Explain the process of obtaining an EUI-64 address, and explain its purpose.
list.answer: This process uses a client's 48-bit Ethernet MAC address, and inserts another 16 bits in the middle of the 48-bit MAC address to create a 64-bit Interface ID. The advantage of EUI-64 is the Ethernet MAC address can be used to determine the Interface ID. It also allows network administrators to easily track an IPv6 address to an end-device using the unique MAC address.
list.answer_simple: This process uses a client's 48-bit Ethernet MAC address, and inserts another 16 bits in the middle of the 48-bit MAC address to create a 64-bit Interface ID. The advantage of EUI-64 is the Ethernet MAC address can be used to determine the Interface ID. It also allows network administrators to easily track an IPv6 address to an end-device using the unique MAC address.

list.question: Which three statements characterize the transport layer protocols? (Choose three.)
list.answer: TCP and UDP port numbers are used by application layer protocols. TCP uses windowing and sequencing to provide reliable transfer of data. TCP is a connection-oriented protocol. UDP is a connectionless protocol.

TCP uses windowing and sequencing to provide reliable transfer of data. TCP is a connection-oriented protocol. UDP is a connectionless protocol. UDP uses windowing and acknowledgments for reliable transfer of data.

list.question: What will a Layer 2 switch do when the destination MAC address of a received frame is not in the MAC table?
list.answer: It forwards the frame out of all ports except for the port at which the frame was received.
list.question_cn: It notifies the sending host that the frame cannot be delivered. It initiates an ARP request. It forwards the frame out of all ports except for the port at which the frame was received. It broadcasts the frame out of all ports on the switch.
list.answer_simple: It forwards the frame out of all ports except for the port at which the frame was received.

list.question: What is a characteristic of the LLC sublayer?
list.answer: It places information in the frame that allows multiple Layer 3 protocols to use the same network interface and media.
list.question_cn: It places information in the frame that allows multiple Layer 3 protocols to use the same network interface and media. It provides delimitation of data according to the physical signaling requirements of the medium. It defines software processes that provide services to the physical layer. It provides the logical addressing required that identifies the device.
list.answer_simple: It places information in the frame that allows multiple Layer 3 protocols to use the same network interface and media.
